Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian Wild Goat style pottery deep plate; yellowish slip. Hook maeander between black bands on flat rim; interior: added red(?) band at junction with rim; ear, horn and shoulder of goat grazing to right; pendant lozenge; trace of pendant rosette; tail of second goat to right. Outside reserved, with three orange-fired bands below rim, below, traces of patterns or spill of glaze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Interior burnt in the bombing of 1941. From same plate as Ashmolean Museum G.117.14
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.746)
